Will Ferrell to Star in a Comedy About the World of Shakespeare by Thomas Swan

CBS Sets Dish Network Blackout Deadline if New Agreement is Not Reached by Cody Schultz

  Movies 
 100 Sexiest Non-English Speaking Actresses #90-81  
 by Thomas Swan 4 years ago  Follow @swnthom5 
 Tweet 
 Share 
x
Pin
 Comment

The goddess aspect is dying out of film. In the past, a male (I’m a male so that’s how I am approaching it) would pick up on foreign films, namely French because of the goddesses who graced the screen. They made us dream because the actresses were not only gorgeous but also spoke a language that was both foreign sounding and lyrical at the same time. These were the first women we could study, so hopefully we could understand them when one presented herself to us. They were the first ones many of us saw naked and let our minds run amuck as out hormones did lambada in our brains.
Link #100-91



Here are Numbers 90-81.
More from Movies
Abominable: A musical DreamWorks tour through China
When is Ad Astra on Digital, Blu-ray and DVD?
Halloween countdown: Best 7 Zombie movies
Frank Whaley romantic comedies you probably forgot about
5 Villains Jonah Hill would be perfect for in the new Batman movie

90.
Marina Fois

born January 21 1970
Years Active: 1986 – Present
Nationality: French
Films to See: Bienvenue au gîte,  J’me sens pas belle, Un petit jeu sans consequence, Happy Few



Fois balances a stage and film career equally. Happy Few is an exquisite example of the poetry that French cinema can produce and Fois and Bouchez were never more gorgeous.

Another actress who has stayed mainly in Europe.
89.
Paola Senatore




born November 9 1949
Years Active 1960s to 1984
Nationality: Italian
Films to See: Salon Kitty, Emanuelle in America,


Born in Rome, Paola Senatore worked in Italian genre in the 1970s and 80s,  including poliziotteschi, commedia sexy all’italiana and giallo films. Senatore appeared in such genre classics as Salon Kitty, Emanuelle in America, and Umberto Lenzi’s cannibal film Eaten Alive!

.In the mid 1980s, after two soft-core erotic films directed by Joe D’Amato, drug problems and pregnancy, she accepted a starring role in a hard-core film, Non stop… sempre buio in sala.
Her film career ended in September 1985 when she was arrested for possession and trafficking of drugs.
88.
Sylvie Testud

born January 17 1971
Years Active: 1991 to Present
Nationality: French
Films to See: La Captive, Murderous Maids, L’idiot
Where as America produces passing fancies, the French seem to produce lasting artists, who don’t take a powder when they hit the age of fifty. Testud saw Charlotte Gainsbourg in a film and was so inspired that she took acting  classes. Testud’s breakout performance came in the film Stupeur et tremblements, adapted from the novel by Amélie Nothomb.

Testud would try her hand at directing in 2012 with the film Another Woman’s Life. Many French actresses at some point write and direct. Film to the French isn’t a flight of fancy, more of a personal statement, as it should be.
87.
Sylvia Kristel

born September 28 1952   died October 18 2012
Years Active: 1973-2010
Nationality: Dutch
Films to See: Emmanuelle, Lady Chatterley’s Lover, Frank en Eva
Sylvia Kristel had the looks but not necessarily the talent. Her most famous role, without a doubt, was as the title character in the Emmanuelle movies. She was Holland’s second most famous export in the 1970s behind Rutger Hauer .

When it came time to do some serious acting, Kristel was only adequate at best. She had some success in the early 80s starring in a series of films produced by B-movie producers Golan and Globus by the end was in sight.


86.
Luciana Paluzzi

born June 10 1937
Years Active: 1953 to 1978
Nationality: Italian
Films to See: Thunderball, 99 Women, The Sensuous Nurse
Two films define Italian born Paluzzi’s career, Thunderball and The Sensuous Nurse, neither of which she was in for very long. That doesn’t take away from that she was very beautiful. In The Sensuous Nurse, she showed off her ample bosom in the only nude scene of her career.

Still, how many people can say they were in a James Bond film?
85.
Adriana Asti

born April 30 1933
Years Active: 1956 to Present
Nationality: Italian
Films to See:Rocco and His Brothers, A Brief Vacation, Le fantôme de la liberté
A diverse career that degenerated  into more into the sex film genre. Still, Asti worked with directors such as Luis Bunuel, Vittorio De Sica and was married to Bernardo Bertolucci.

Asti took a notorious turn in the movie Caligula where a group of boy slaves ejaculated on her. Cinema! One day you’re starring in a De Sica film, the next day, Mario’s sperm is on your naked body.


84.
Valerie Lemercier

born March 8 1964
Years Active: 1988 to Present
Nationality: French
Films to See: Le Derrière, Vendredi soir, Avenue Montaigne
Born in Dieppe, Seine-Maritime, she grew up in Gonzeville and then studied at the Rouen Conservatoire – a dance, music and drama school. Lemercier made her screen debut in 1988, in the television series Palace. Lemercier has won two César Award for her supporting roles in Les Visiteurs, Fauteuils d’orchestre.

She released her first music album, Valérie Lemercier chante, in 1996, and has subsequently recorded three singles with other singers.
83.
Lilli Palmer

born May 24, 1914  died January 27 1986
Years Active: 1933 to 1985
Nationality: German
Films to See: Secret Agent, Cloak and Dagger, Beware of Pity
German actress of the 1930s and 40s who escaped Nazi Germany. Married Rex Harrison and eventually returned to Germany.

82.
Martina Gedeck

born September 14 1961
Years Active: 1981 to Present
Nationality: German
Films to See: Summer ’04, Agnosia, The Lives of Others
In 1994, Gedeck gained the attention of film audiences with her performance in Sönke Wortmann’s hit comedy Maybe… Maybe Not. In 1995, Gedeck received critical praise for her award-winning performance in the television drama Hölleisengretl. In 1997, she furthered her reputation with her performance as Lilo in Wolfgang Becker’s Life is All You Get..

 In 1997, she received the German Film Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role for her performance as a shy waitress in Helmut Dietl’s Rossini – oder die mörderische Frage, wer mit wem schlief.  By the end of the 1990s, Gedeck had established herself as “one of the most prolific character actresses in Germany” with ambitious feature films such as Jew-Boy Levi (Viehjud Levi) and television dramas like Dominik Graf’s Deine besten Jahre. She garnered awards and nominations throughout this period of her career.
81.


Emmanuelle Devos

born May 10 1964
Years Active: 1986 to Present
Nationality: French
Films to See: Esther Kahn, Artemisia, Coco Avant Chanel
We arrive at the last entry for this segment. French actress Emmanuelle Devos is an interesting, unconventional actresses looks wise. Very talented and very French.

 
 
.
